# Docstring Models Documentation

## Overview

This module contains the data models for storing structured docstring information. It provides a comprehensive set of classes to represent different types of docstring elements and sections, allowing for organized parsing and representation of documentation data.

## Purpose

The module serves as the foundation for docstring parsing and representation in the Griffe project, providing:

- **Element Models**: Classes to represent individual documented items (parameters, return values, classes, etc.)
- **Section Models**: Classes to represent different sections within docstrings (parameters section, examples section, etc.)
- **Serialization Support**: Built-in dictionary conversion for data export

## Core Architecture

### Base Classes

#### `DocstringElement`
The foundational base class for all docstring elements.

```python
element = DocstringElement(
    description="Description of the element",
    annotation="Type annotation"
)
```

**Key Features:**
- Stores description and optional type annotation
- Provides `as_dict()` method for serialization

#### `DocstringNamedElement`
Extends `DocstringElement` to include named elements with optional values.

```python
named_element = DocstringNamedElement(
    name="parameter_name",
    description="Parameter description",
    annotation="str",
    value="default_value"
)
```

## Element Classes

### Special Elements

#### `DocstringAdmonition`
Represents admonitions (notes, warnings, etc.) in documentation.

```python
admonition = DocstringAdmonition(
    annotation="warning",  # kind
    description="Important warning message"
)
```

**Properties:**
- `kind`: Alias for annotation (type of admonition)
- `contents`: Alias for description (admonition text)

#### `DocstringDeprecated`
Represents deprecated items with version information.

```python
deprecated = DocstringDeprecated(
    annotation="2.0.0",  # version
    description="This feature is deprecated"
)
```

### Documentation Elements

| Class | Purpose | Example Usage |
|-------|---------|---------------|
| `DocstringParameter` | Function/method parameters | `DocstringParameter("arg", description="Input argument")` |
| `DocstringReturn` | Return values | `DocstringReturn("result", description="Computed result")` |
| `DocstringYield` | Generator yield values | `DocstringYield("item", description="Yielded item")` |
| `DocstringRaise` | Raised exceptions | `DocstringRaise(description="ValueError: Invalid input")` |
| `DocstringAttribute` | Class/module attributes | `DocstringAttribute("attr", description="Class attribute")` |
| `DocstringFunction` | Function documentation | `DocstringFunction("func", description="Utility function")` |
| `DocstringClass` | Class documentation | `DocstringClass("MyClass", description="Custom class")` |
| `DocstringModule` | Module documentation | `DocstringModule("utils", description="Utility module")` |

## Section Classes

### Base Section Class

#### `DocstringSection`
Base class for all docstring sections.

```python
section = DocstringSection(title="Optional Section Title")
```

**Key Features:**
- `kind`: Section type identifier (from `DocstringSectionKind` enum)
- `title`: Optional section title
- `value`: Section content
- `__bool__()`: Returns True if section has content
- `as_dict()`: Serialization support

### Section Types

#### Text Sections
```python
text_section = DocstringSectionText(
    value="This is the main description text",
    title="Description"
)
```

#### Parameter Sections
```python
params_section = DocstringSectionParameters(
    value=[DocstringParameter("arg1", description="First argument")],
    title="Parameters"
)

other_params_section = DocstringSectionOtherParameters(
    value=[DocstringParameter("kwargs", description="Additional arguments")]
)
```

#### Exception Sections
```python
raises_section = DocstringSectionRaises(
    value=[DocstringRaise(description="ValueError: Invalid input")]
)

warns_section = DocstringSectionWarns(
    value=[DocstringWarn(description="DeprecationWarning: Old API")]
)
```

#### Return/Yield Sections
```python
returns_section = DocstringSectionReturns(
    value=[DocstringReturn("result", description="Computation result")]
)

yields_section = DocstringSectionYields(
    value=[DocstringYield("item", description="Next item")]
)
```

#### Examples Section
```python
examples_section = DocstringSectionExamples(
    value=[
        (DocstringSectionKind.text, ">>> example_function()"),
        (DocstringSectionKind.examples, "'result'")
    ]
)
```

#### Structure Sections
- `DocstringSectionAttributes`: For class/module attributes
- `DocstringSectionFunctions`: For function listings
- `DocstringSectionClasses`: For class listings  
- `DocstringSectionModules`: For module listings

#### Special Sections
```python
deprecated_section = DocstringSectionDeprecated(
    version="2.0.0",
    text="This function will be removed",
    title="Deprecated"
)

admonition_section = DocstringSectionAdmonition(
    kind="note",
    text="Important information",
    title="Note"
)
```

## Key Features

### Serialization
All classes support dictionary serialization via `as_dict()`:

```python
element = DocstringParameter("arg", description="Argument", annotation="str")
data = element.as_dict()
# Returns: {"name": "arg", "description": "Argument", "annotation": "str"}
```

### Type Safety
- Uses type hints throughout
- Conditional imports with `TYPE_CHECKING`
- Support for both string and `Expr` annotations

### Extensibility
- Clean inheritance hierarchy
- Consistent interface across all elements
- Easy to extend with new element types

## Usage Notes

### Best Practices
- Always provide meaningful descriptions for elements
- Use appropriate section types for organized documentation
- Leverage the inheritance hierarchy for custom extensions

### Important Considerations
